channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL

item.title: Report X-2024070034
item.description:
Report X-2024070034

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: TWO AIR PACKAGES REQUIRED PACKAGE REWRAP. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EACH PACKAGE CONTAINED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO ANOTHER CONSIGNEE IN THE USA IS 1ZHE7024NY15708572. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER HE7024, ZEROCARTB LYFE, 1009 12B RD, BOURBON IN 46504-9727.

item.title: Report X-2024061910
item.description:
Report X-2024061910

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-02T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: HODGKINS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER SENT TO A LEAKING HAZMAT IN OUTBOUND 6. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO CONTAINERIZE THE LEAKING HAZMAT AND CLEAN UP THE SPILLED MATERIAL. PACKAGE AND MATERIAL WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. INFORMATION WAS COLLECTED ON ALL SIX SIDES OF PACKAGE AND MATERIAL WAS SOLIDIFIED AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report E-2024060679
item.description:
Report E-2024060679

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: EDWARDSVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-6ft area of the concrete/asphalt lot and estimated that three (3) gallons of material was released due to a fall during offloading that damaged seven (7) 5-gallon metal pails. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and recovered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was transported to the nearest Dayton Freight terminal for terminal personnel to coordinate disposal. The seven (7) damaged pails were containerized into two (2) 55-gallon metal drums and placed into the Dayton Freight trailer for transport to the nearest terminal.

item.title: Report E-2024060666
item.description:
Report E-2024060666

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: EAST SAINT LOUIS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of printer ink was damaged in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged pail of UN1210 was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.description:
Report I-2024060069

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-18
  • City: Chicago
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: QATAR AIRWAYS CARGO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 157-30865133 ORD/AMS Total 15 Pcs/3271 Kgs Shipment booked as general cargo and arrived at Qatar Airways facility. Commodity in AWB indicated"Consolidation" without any lithium battery statement. The skids were shrink wrapped in black and inside are boxes with UN3091/ELM labels. All 15 pcs were rejected at door and sent back to customer. Advised Shipper of ELM label.

item.title: Report E-2024060630
item.description:
Report E-2024060630

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-11
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 21 , 2024, at 0946 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the release of Isopropyl Alcohol. It was reported terminal personnel discovered a release of approximately 1 cup of Isopropyl Alcohol (UN1219, 3, II) from (1) 55-gallon DM due to being punctured. The release impacted the side of the drum only. Terminal personnel were able to patch the puncture to the drum, then placed the damaged drum into a 95-gallon overpack DF. Terminal personnel then cleaned the release with the appropriate PPE.

item.title: Report E-2024060581
item.description:
Report E-2024060581

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 21, 2024, at 0911 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the release of Zep Zepresto. It was reported that the terminal personnel discovered a release of a total of 1 cup of ZEP ZEPRESTO (UN2922, Corrosive liquids, toxic. n.o.s. (Cresylic Acid Methylene Chloride), 8, 6.1, II) from (2) 20-gallon DM’s due to improper packaging. The release impacted shrink wrap and a pallet. Terminal personnel were able to patch the puncture to the drums, then placed the damaged drums into a 95-gallon overpack DF. Terminal personnel then cleaned the release with the appropriate PPE.

  • Description: A worker was about to hook to a trailer to pull it away from the dock and out into the yard when he noticed that the nose of the trailer was leaking. CURA was called to handle cleaning the spill and advised that it appeared a wrapped pallet of pails had shifted in transit which caused some of the pa ils to topple and one of those pails was punctured as it fell which caused the release.
